question_sentence: Spotify agreed to pull which artist's music after they accused the platform of spreading COVID-19 vaccine misinformation?
Bengals Pro Bowl wideout Ja’Marr Chase said which coach told him he “couldn’t play receiver” coming out of high school?
President Joe Biden was heard on a hot mic calling a Fox News reporter a "stupid son of a b—” after the reporter asked him about what?
Elon Musk said he would do what if McDonald's agreed to accept Dogecoin?
Which of these players was elected into the Baseball Hall of Fame this week?
An international United Airlines flight from New Jersey to Israel turned back mid-flight after two passengers did what?
choices: Went to sleep on the floor

question_sentence: This politician tested positive for coronavirus, delaying her day in court over defamation claims against the New York Times. Who is she?
A truck carrying 100 of these animals crashed on a Pennsylvania highway, and several scampered away. What type of animal was it?
Supreme Court Justice Stephen Breyer is planning on stepping down at the end of this term. What year was he nominated to the court?
Amy Schneider’s historic run on 'Jeopardy!' came to an end on an episode that aired this week. How many consecutive games did she win?
Which cabinet minister said a general election should be called if Boris Johnson was ousted as prime minister?
evidence: Rees-Mogg told Newsnight’s Kirsty Wark that the UK had moved to ‘an essentially presidential system’, meaning ‘any prime minister would be very well advised to seek a fresh mandate’

question_sentence: Which tennis player became the first Australian in 42 years to reach the women’s singles final of the Australian Open?
evidence: Two-time grand slam champion Barty is ‘one win away from becoming the first Australian – man or woman – to win the singles since Christine O’Neil won the title in 1978’, said the BBC

question_sentence: A mandate requiring postal staff to wear company-provided cloth face coverings rather than their own N95 masks has caused a row in which country?
evidence: Canada Post said it was seeking ‘clarification’ from the federal government after facing a backlash for banning the company’s 64,000-strong workforce from wearing N95 respirator-style masks at work

question_sentence: The derogatory term ‘snowflake’ is thought to have originated from which 1990s cult novel?
evidence: Chuck Palahniuk’s 1996 novel, which was adapted into a film starring Brad Pitt and Edward Norton, includes the line: ‘You are not a beautiful and unique snowflake. You are the same decaying organic matter as everyone else’

question_sentence: Kiev Mayor Vitali Klitschko accused which country of ‘betraying its friends’ in banning arms exports to his country despite rising tensions with Russia?
evidence: As Russian troops mass on Ukraine’s border, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz is sticking to his country’s long-standing policy against exporting weapons to conflict zones

question_sentence: What is the name of the Conservative MP who claimed they were sacked as a minister because of their ‘Muslimness’?
evidence: Boris Johnson has ordered the Cabinet Office to investigate claims that a Conservative Party whip told Ghani that her faith made her ‘colleagues feel uncomfortable’

question_sentence: The Queen will mark her accession day at which royal residence?
evidence: The Queen is expected to be residing at Prince Philip’s cottage on the estate when she celebrates the 70th anniversary of her reign on 6 February

question_sentence: The EU has launched legal action against which country over ‘discriminatory trade practices’ targeting member state Lithuania?
evidence: EU Trade Commissioner Valdis Dombrovskis said that launching the case against Beijing at the World Trade Organization ‘is not a step we take lightly’, but that ‘we see the no other way forward’

question_sentence: Anti-vaccination activists have been citing what ‘bogus’ legal defence of their bids to derail Covid-19 jab rollouts and regulations?
evidence: Anti-vaxxers citing the sovereign defence wrongly claim that they can ‘opt out’ of laws with which they do not agree based on a clause in the Magna Carta

question_sentence: The Foreign Office has named which Ukrainian media magnate as Vladimir Putin’s favoured candidate to lead a puppet regime in Kiev?
evidence: Analysts were ‘taken aback’ by the claim that Murayev was ‘the Kremlin’s pick for a puppet government’, with some suggesting that he is a ‘marginal figure’, according to The Telegraph

question_sentence: Which Supreme Court Justice is retiring after serving nearly 30 years on the bench?
evidence: Supreme Court Justice Stephen Breyer announced his plans to retire, clearing the way for President Joe Biden to select a nomination to the high court. Biden has vowed to fill the vacancy with an African American woman, which would represent a historic first.

question_sentence: Health officials announced the postponement of which popular in-person gathering this week due to a spike in Covid-19 cases?
evidence: The cities of São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro have postponed their official Carnival parades because Covid-19 cases are sharply increasing in the region. This comes just weeks after both cities canceled their informal street parades.

question_sentence: Extreme weather and new coronavirus outbreaks are disrupting production overseas and causing major product delays. That’s leading to a shortage of this item, which could create another wave of factory shutdowns and furloughed workers in the US.
evidence: A major computer chip shortage has left some manufacturers with only five days’ worth of inventory due to supply chain woes.

question_sentence: In preparation for a possible Russian invasion, how many pounds of weapons did the US send Ukraine this week?
evidence: The US sent close to 200,000 pounds of lethal aid and ammunition to support Ukraine’s defense ahead of a possible Russian attack.

question_sentence: 62% of British adults say UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson should resign after he allegedly engaged in what activity while the rest of his country was under strict Covid-19 lockdowns?
choices: flew in family against travel restrictions
evidence: Johnson was forced to apologize to Queen Elizabeth after it emerged that Johnson held a party in Downing Street the night before the funeral of Prince Philip. It was noted at the time that due to Covid-19 restrictions, the Queen was forced to mourn her husband at St. George’s Chapel at Windsor Castle while sitting alone.

question_sentence: Bitter cold weather conditions caused mysterious ice formations to show up along Chicago’s Lake Michigan shoreline. What do the ice figures resemble, which also lends them their unique name?
evidence: Ice pancakes — round flat discs made of ice — were found at Rogers Park, which is about 10 miles north of downtown Chicago.

question_sentence: What hot-button college issue will the Supreme Court reconsider next year in the form of two high-profile cases?
choices: the legality of fraternity and sororities
the right to carry firearms on campus
evidence: The Supreme Court said it will reconsider race-based affirmative action in college admissions, a move that could eliminate campus practices that have widely benefitted Black and Hispanic students.

question_sentence: Burkina Faso’s army has said it has taken control of the country, dissolved the government, and shuttered its borders. Where is Burkina Faso?
evidence: Plans for a military coup have been underway in the West African country since August. Civilians gathered on the streets honking car horns and cheering in support of the military following the announcement.

question_sentence: How many US deaths could be prevented each year if adults over 40 added 10 minutes of daily moderate to vigorous physical activity, according to a recent study?
evidence: More than 110,000 US deaths could be prevented, according to a study published in the journal JAMA Internal Medicine. An increase of 20 or 30 minutes could lead to even more lives saved.

question_sentence: The Biden administration has authorized more than $2.5 billion in arms sales to which country despite ongoing concerns about its human rights record?
evidence: The US has authorized more than $2.5 billion in arms sales to Egypt despite ongoing concerns about Cairo’s human rights record. The Egyptian government has been charged with serious human rights abuses, including unlawful or arbitrary killings, forced disappearance, torture, harsh and life-threatening prison conditions among other charges.
